010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVectorSeparable;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
017import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
018import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
019
020/**
021* <p>
022 * Vector and separable version of the Bilateral filter as proposed in [1], 
023 * for RGB images ({@link ColorProcessor}) only.
024 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
025 * image types. See Sec. 17.2 of [2] for additional details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
029 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
030 * Bombay, India.
031 * <br>
032 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
033 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2021/01/01
038 */
039public class BilateralFilterVectorSeparable extends GenericFilterVectorSeparable implements BilateralF {
040        
041        private final float[] Hd;       // the 1D domain kernel
042        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
043        private final double sigmaR2;
044        private final VectorNorm colorNorm;
045        private final double colorScale2;
046        
047        public BilateralFilterVectorSeparable() {
048                this(new Parameters());
049        }
050        
051        public BilateralFilterVectorSeparable(Parameters params) {
052                GaussianKernel1D kernel = new GaussianKernel1D(params.sigmaD);
053                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
054                this.K = kernel.getXc();
055                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
056                this.colorNorm = params.colorNormType.getInstance();
057                this.colorScale2 = sqr(colorNorm.getScale(3));
058        }
059        
060        @Override
061        protected float[] doPixelX(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
062                return filterPixelXY(source, u, v, true);
063        }
064
065        @Override
066        protected float[] doPixelY(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
067                return filterPixelXY(source, u, v, false);
068        }
069        
070        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
071        
072        private float[] filterPixelXY(PixelPack source, int u, int v, boolean isX) {
073                float[] S = new float[3];       // sum of weighted RGB (initialized to zero)
074                float W = 0;                                            // sum of weights
075                float[] a = source.getPix(u, v);
076                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
077                        final float[] b = (isX) ? source.getPix(u + m, v) : source.getPix(u, v + m);
078                        float wd = Hd[m + K];                                                                                           // domain weight
079                        float wr = similarityGauss(a, b);
080                        float w = wd * wr;
081                        S[0] = S[0] + w * b[0];
082                        S[1] = S[1] + w * b[1];
083                        S[2] = S[2] + w * b[2];
084                        W = W + w;
085                }
086                S[0] = S[0] / W;
087                S[1] = S[1] / W;
088                S[2] = S[2] / W;
089                return S;
090        }
091        
092        // ------------------------------------------------------
093        
094        // This returns the weights for a Gaussian range kernel (color vector version):
095        private float similarityGauss(float[] A, float[] B) {
096                double d2 = colorScale2 * colorNorm.distance2(A, B);
097                return (float) Math.exp(-d2 / (2 * sigmaR2));
098        }
099
100}
